00019 #define ERR_DIR_NOT_OPEN "Directory could not be opened."
00020 #define ERR_DIR_STAT_FAILED "Stat could not be read."
00021 #define ERR_DIR_CH_FAILED "Directory could not be changed."
00022 
00023 #define MAX_OPTIONS 20
00024 
00025 /*
00026  * Functions prototypes
00027  */
00028 
00029 void find(char *);
00030 int list(const char*, const struct stat *, int);
00031 
00032 /*
00033  * Global variables;
00034  */
00035 static int verbose_flag;
00036 char **options_array = NULL;
00037 char **argument_array = NULL;
00038 int opt_arg_array_index = 0;
00039 
00040 
00041 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00042 {
00043     // If no last argument is provided,
00044     // then consider root as default.
00045     char *search_path = NULL;
00046     int c;
00047 
00048     // Dynamic alocate memory.
00049     options_array = malloc(MAX_OPTIONS * sizeof(char *));
00050     argument_array = malloc(20 * sizeof(char *));
00051 
00052     while (1) {
00053        static struct option long_options[] = {
00054            /* These options set a flag. */
00055            {"verbose",      0, &verbose_flag, 1},
00056            {"brief",        0, &verbose_flag, 0},
00057            /* These options don't set a flag.
00058               We distinguish them by their indices. */
00059             {"amin",        1, 0, 'a'},
00060             {"anewer",      1, 0, 'b'},
00061             {"atime",       1, 0, 'c'},
00062             {"cmin",        1, 0, 'd'},
00063             {"cnewer",      1, 0, 'e'},
00064             {"ctime",       1, 0, 'f'},
00065             {"mmin",        1, 0, 'g'},
00066             {"newer",       1, 0, 'h'},
00067             {"mtime",       1, 0, 'i'},
00068             {"name",        1, 0, 'j'},
00069             {"iname",       1, 0, 'k'},
00070             {"type",        1, 0, 'l'},
00071             {"size",        1, 0, 'm'},
00072             {"perm",        1, 0, 'n'},
00073             {"readable",    1, 0, 'o'},
00074             {"executable",  1, 0, 'p'},
00075             {"writable",    1, 0, 'r'},
00076             {0, 0, 0, 0}
00077         };
00078 
00079        /* getopt_long stores the option index here. */
00080        int option_index = 0;
00081 
00082        c = getopt_long_only (argc, argv, "a:b:c:d:e:f:g:h:i:j:k:l:m:n:o:p:r:",
00083                              long_options, &option_index);
00084 
00085        /* Detect the end of the options. */
00086        if (c == -1)
00087          break;
00088 
00089        switch (c) {
00090          case 0:
00091            /* If this option set a flag, do nothing else now. */
00092            if (long_options[option_index].flag != 0)
00093              break;
00094            printf ("option %s", long_options[option_index].name);
00095            if (optarg)
00096              printf (" with arg %s", optarg);
00097            printf ("\n");
00098          break;
00099 
00101          case 'a':
00102            options_array[opt_arg_array_index] = malloc(100 * sizeof(char));
00103            strcpy(options_array[opt_arg_array_index], "amin");
00104 
00105            argument_array[opt_arg_array_index] = malloc(sizeof(optarg));
00106            strcpy(argument_array[opt_arg_array_index], optarg);
00107 
00108            opt_arg_array_index++;
00109          break;
00110 
00112          case 'l':
00113            options_array[opt_arg_array_index] = malloc(100 * sizeof(char));
00114            strcpy(options_array[opt_arg_array_index], "type");
00115 
00116            argument_array[opt_arg_array_index] = malloc(sizeof(optarg));
00117            strcpy(argument_array[opt_arg_array_index], optarg);
00118 
00119            opt_arg_array_index++;
00120          break;
00121 
00122          case '?':
00123            /* getopt_long already printed an error message. */
00124            break;
00125 
00126          default:
00127            abort ();
00128          }
00129      }
00130 
00131     search_path = malloc(100 * sizeof(char));
00132 
00133     /* Any remaining command line argument is considered to be the search path. */
00134     if (optind < argc) {
00135        search_path = argv[optind++];
00136     } else {
00137        search_path = "/";
00138     }
00139 
00140     find(search_path);
00141 
00142     return 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 
00146 int list(const char *name, const struct stat *status, int type) {
00147     // FTW_F    The object is a  file
00148     // FTW_D    ,,    ,,   ,, ,, directory
00149     // FTW_DNR  ,,    ,,   ,, ,, directory that could not be read
00150     // FTW_SL   ,,    ,,   ,, ,, symbolic link
00151     // FTW_NS   The object is NOT a symbolic link and is one for
00152     //          which stat() could not be executed
00153 
00154     if(type == FTW_NS)
00155         return 0;
00156 
00157     int is_valid_result = 1;
00158 
00159     // If we have elements in the options array,
00160     // then apply search filters, else simply act
00161     // as recursive "ls".
00162     if(opt_arg_array_index > 0) {
00163         int i;
00164         for(i=0; i<opt_arg_array_index; i++) {
00166             if(strcmp(options_array[opt_arg_array_index], "amin") == 0) {
00167                 char *argument = argument_array[opt_arg_array_index];
00168 
00169                 if(argument[0] == '+') {
00170                     //status->st_atime
00171                 } else if(argument[0] == '-') {
00172 
00173                 } else {
00174 
00175                 }
00176 
00177                 is_valid_result = 0;
00178             }
00179 
00181             if(strcmp(options_array[opt_arg_array_index], "type") == 0) {
00182                 is_valid_result = 0;
00183 
00184                 if((strcmp(argument_array[opt_arg_array_index], "file") == 0) &&
00185                     type == FTW_F)
00186                     is_valid_result = 1;
00187                 if((strcmp(argument_array[opt_arg_array_index], "directory") == 0) &&
00188                     type == FTW_D)
00189                     is_valid_result = 1;
00190                 if((strcmp(argument_array[opt_arg_array_index], "link") == 0) &&
00191                     type == FTW_SL)
00192                     is_valid_result = 1;
00193             }
00194 
00195         }
00196     }
00197 
00198     if(is_valid_result) {
00199         if(type == FTW_F)
00200             printf("%s\n", name);
00201 
00202         if(type == FTW_D && strcmp(".", name) != 0)
00203             printf("%s/\n", name);
00204     }
00205 
00206     return 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 void find(char *path) {
00210     printf("Results found:\n\n");
00211     ftw(path, list, 1);
00212 }
